10.comment: A tree view morph. You can visualize a graph of object data with it (for example).

119.comment: A simple box morph. A really blue one. Its amazing what you can build out of simple boxes.... Who needs stars when you got blue rectangles!

120.author: lauritz
120.message: Disabled grabbing and dragging on other submorphs as well...

341.comment: Displays object properties and provides a workspace. The workspace's context is set to the last clicked element.

344.author: lauritz
344.message: added >>expandAllNodes() which can expand complete trees, but not graphs.

354.author: lauritz
354.message: convenience preset by default: tree is expanded, workspace says "this"

356.author: lauritz
356.message: Disabled grabbing and dragging on other morphs as well.

358.author: lauritz
358.message: Disabled dragging and grabbing on tree nodes. Those should only be clickable.

360.author: lauritz
360.message: Fixed a bug by adding a condition to getClassNameOf. In case an object has no constructor.

368.author: lauritz
368.message: corrected the order of array elements

372.author: lauritz
372.message: significantly reduced a performance problem regarding "long" string properties, doesnt freeze anymore.

374.author: lauritz
374.message: clicking a node no longer resets the workspace content

378.author: lauritz
378.message: asynchronous >>#toggleAll, because toggling is actually asynchronous and rendering as well...

380.author: lauritz
380.message: cleaned up how all typeof stuff
